Gardens'|date=April 9, 2009|publisher=Variety|first=Brian|last=Lowry}} [[Katie Holmes]] portrays Kennedy in the 2011 miniseries ''[[The Kennedys (TV miniseries)|The Kennedys]]'', set during the Kennedy presidency and its 2017 sequel ''[[The Kennedys: After Camelot]]'', focusing on her life after 1968.{{cite web|last=Andreeva |first=Nellie |url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/katie-holmes-the-kennedys-after-camelot-miniseries-jackie-o-reelz-850124/ |title=Katie Holmes To Return As Jackie O In 'The Kennedys: After Camelot' Reelz Mini |publisher=Deadline |date=October 13, 2014 |accessdate=April 12, 2017}}{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/kennedys-camelot-stars-katie-holmes-matthew-perry-playing-icons-familys-legacy-986763|first=Lexy|last=Perez|title=Camelot' Premiere: Katie Holmes, Matthew Perry on Playing Icons and the Family's Legacy|date=March 16, 2017|publisher=Hollywood Reporter}} Mary McNamara{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/apr/01/entertainment/la-et-kennedys-review-20110401|title=Television review: 'The Kennedys'|first=Mary|last=McNamara|date=April 1, 2011|quote=Holmes is pretty as Jackie, but her emotions are confined to happy ("I love him") and sad ("He cheats on me"), with absolutely no nuance and only the occasional flash of spirit, intellect and inner strength that made Jacqueline Kennedy an icon in her own right. }} and Hank Stuever{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/tv-review-about-the-kennedys-like-the-kennedys-but-never-fully-the-kennedys/2011/03/30/AFHzXQCC_story.html|title=TV review: About the Kennedys, like the Kennedys, but never fully 'The Kennedys'|first=Hank|last=Stuever|date=March 31, 2011|publisher=Washington Post|quote=And is Holmes's whispery Jackie sounding a tad Edith Bunker in the later episodes? She's not altogether terrible in the part, which doesn't give her a lot to work with; as written, Jackie is a jittery phantom in capri pants and Oleg Cassini gowns.}} regarded Holmes' performance with neutrality in their reviews of ''The Kennedys'' while Hadley Freeman called her "bloodless" in the role.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/apr/04/the-kennedys-old-ground-jfk|title=The Kennedys retreads of old grounds in life and lore of JFK|publisher=The Guardian|date=April 4, 2011}} Holmes stated reprising the role was a "bigger challenge" for having to act through later periods of Kennedy's life.{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/tv/2017/01/13/katie-holmes-compares-her-jackie-natalie-portmans/96536806/|title=Katie Holmes compares her 'Jackie' to Natalie Portman's|first=Robert|last=Bianco|date=January 13, 2017|publisher=USA Today}} When asked of the concurrent ''Jackie'' film, Holmes said, "I think its really exciting. It's just is a testament to how amazing Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis was and how much she meant to our country."{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/katie-holmes-talks-reprising-jackie-kennedy-role-964113 |title=Katie Holmes Talks Reprising Jackie Kennedy Role After 'Jackie': There's Room for Both|first=Kate|last=Stanhope|publisher=Hollywood Reporter|date=January 13, 2017}} Holmes also stated both should be watched due to covering different periods of Jacqueline's life.{{cite news|url=http://www.startribune.com/matthew-perry-on-ted-kennedy-by-far-the-most-challenging-role-i-ve-ever-played/417681843/|title=Matthew Perry on Ted Kennedy: "By far the most challenging role I've ever played"|date=March 30, 2017|publisher=StarTribune}} In ''The Kennedys: After Camelot'', Holmes' performance was viewed favorably by Daniel Feinberg{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/kennedys-camelot-review-990468|title='The Kennedys: After Camelot': TV Review|date=March 31, 2017|first=Daniel|last=Feinberg|publisher=The Hollywood Reporter}} and Allison Keane{{cite news|url=http://collider.com/the-kennedys-after-camelot-review-katie-holmes/#images|title='The Kennedys – After Camelot' Review: Katie Holmes, Matthew Perry Take on Accents, Accountability|first=Allison|last=Keane|date=March 31, 2017|quote=Holmes embodies the reserved but hopeful Jackie much more so than Perry feels right as Ted (though Holmes has had more practice at it). But the reality is that the material is never more than a boilerplate biopic, plodding along with a conventional set up and a schmaltzy score that tries to infuse emotion where it hasn't been earned.}} while Kristi Turnquist panned her.{{cite news|url=http://www.oregonlive.com/tv/2017/04/the_kennedys_after_camelot_bur.html|title='The Kennedys: After Camelot' buries Katie Holmes, Matthew Perry in bad wigs and lousy writing (review)|date=April 1, 2017|publisher=oregonlive.com|first=Kristi|last=Turnquist}} [[Minka Kelly]] portrays Kennedy in the 2013 film ''[[The Butler]]'', giving the film's protagonist Cecil one of her husband's neckties after his assassination.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/minka-kelly-to-play-jackie-kennedy-in-the-butler/|title=Minka Kelly to play Jackie Kennedy in 'The Butler'|first=Jessica|last=Derschowitz|date=May 25, 2012|publisher=CBS News}}{{cite news|url=http://people.com/celebrity/oprah-winfrey-minka-kelly-costar-in-the-butler/|title=Minka Kelly: 'I'm Not Worthy' of Acting with Oprah|date=February 8, 2013|first=Jennifer|last=Cress|publisher=People}} Kelly said she was intimidated and scared taking on the role.{{cite news|url=http://www.lifeandstylemag.com/posts/minka-kelly-it-was-intimidating-playing-jackie-kennedy-in-the-butler-32809|title=Minka Kelly: It Was "Intimidating" Playing Jackie Kennedy in 'The Butler'|publisher=Life&Style|date=August 2, 2013}} Kelly admitted to having difficulty with perfecting Kennedy's voice, going "to sleep listening to her", and having discomfort with the wool clothing associated with the role.{{cite news|url=http://people.com/celebrity/oprah-winfrey-minka-kelly-costar-in-the-butler/|title=Minka Kelly: 'I'm Not Worthy' of Acting with Oprah|first=Jennifer|last=Cress|date=February 8, 2013|publisher=People.com}} [[Ginnifer Goodwin]] portrays her in the 2013 television film ''[[Killing Kennedy (film)|Killing Kennedy]]''.{{cite news|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2013/05/28/rob-lowe-to-play-jfk/ | title=Rob Lowe to play JFK in Nat Geo movie | author=Hibberd, James | publisher=''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' | date=May 28, 2013 | accessdate=May 28, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://ew.com/article/2013/06/20/who-makes-a-better-jackie-kennedy-ginnifer-goodwin-or-katie-holmes-poll/|title=Who makes a better Jackie Kennedy: Ginnifer Goodwin or Katie Holmes? -- POLL|date=June 20, 2013|first=Bronwyn|last=Barnes|publisher=Entertainment Weekly}} Goodwin used intimate photos to better portray Kennedy and was concerned "to do her justice and to play her as accurately as possible without ever doing an impression of her".{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/tv/2013/11/10/ginnifer-goodwin-killing-kennedy/3432713/|title=Ginnifer Goodwin channels Jackie Kennedy's intimate side|first=Brian|last=Truitt|date=November 10, 2013|publisher=USA Today}} Costar [[Rob Lowe]] said of seeing Goodwin in the pink Chanel suit, "It made it real. If I were under any illusions about what we were doing, seeing her in that iconic moment was, I would say, sobering."{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2013/11/08/killing-kennedy-co-star-ginnifer-goodwin-says-rob-lowe-was-channeling-jfk.html|date=November 8, 2013|title='Killing Kennedy': Co-star Ginnifer Goodwin says Rob Lowe was channeling JFK|publisher=Fox News}} Tom Carson wrote that Goodwin's "trademark vulnerability humanizes Jackie considerably"{{cite news|url=https://www.gq.com/story/killing-kennedy-gq-review-tom-carson|title=The GQ Review: Killing Kennedys Is Way More Fun Than The Zillion Other JFK Biopics|first=Tom|last=Carson|publisher=gq.com|date=November 8, 2013}} while Bruce Miller called her a miscast{{cite news|url=http://siouxcityjournal.com/entertainment/television/review-killing-kennedy-offers-respectful-but-grating-view-of-assassination/article_5536a56c-3c7d-5ba4-9e7a-9c9a9aa7fa04.html|title=Review: 'Killing Kennedy' offers respectful but grating view of assassination | date=November 9, 2013|first=Bruce|last=Miller|publisher=siouxcityjournal.com}} and Robert Lloyd{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/nov/08/entertainment/la-et-st-killing-kennedy-20131108|title=Review: 'Killing Kennedy' is not the stuff of legend|date=November 8, 2013|publisher=Los Angeles Times|first=Robert|last=Lloyd}} and Brian Lowry{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2013/tv/reviews/tv-review-killing-kennedy-1200775724/|date=November 5, 2013|publisher=Variety|first=Brian|last=Lowry|title=TV Review: 'Killing Kennedy'}} panned her performance. [[Kim Allen (actress)|Kim Allen]] portrays Kennedy in the 2016 film ''[[LBJ (film)|LBJ]]''.{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/lbj-kim-allen-jackie-kennedy-rob-reiner-1201574133/|first=Dave|last=McNary|title=Kim Allen Cast as Jackie Kennedy in Rob Reiner's 'LBJ'|date=August 19, 2015|publisher=Variety}} Ray Bennett noted in his review of the film that Allen was in a non-speaking role.{{cite news|url=http://www.thecliffedge.com/?p=8719|title=TIFF FILM REVIEW: Rob Reiner's 'LBJ'|date=September 15, 2016|publisher=thecliffedge.com}} [[Natalie Portman]] portrays Kennedy in the 2016 film ''[[Jackie (2016 film)|Jackie]]'', set during the JFK presidency and the immediate aftermath of the assassination.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/markets-festivals/natalie-portman-jackie-kennedy-darren-aronofsky-pablo-larrain-insiders-1201495805/|title=Natalie Portman to Star as Jacqueline Kennedy in New Drama (EXCLUSIVE)|website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|first=John|last=Hopewell|date=May 14, 2015|accessdate=June 15, 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/la-en-mn-natalie-portman-jackie-oscars-20170126-story.html|title=Natalie Portman's four steps — some simple, some not — to becoming Jackie Kennedy |date=January 26, 2017|first=Glenn|last=Whipp|publisher=Los Angeles Times}} Portman admitted being intimidated taking the role and doing research in preparation for filming.{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.in/How-Natalie-Portman-prepared-for-her-Oscar-worthy-performance-as-Jackie-Kennedy/articleshow/54319281.cms|title=How Natalie Portman prepared for her Oscar-worthy performance as Jackie Kennedy|author=Jason Gurrrasio|work=[[Business Insider]]|date=September 14, 2016|accessdate=October 9, 2016}} Nigel M. Smith wrote that by portraying Kennedy, Portman was "taking on arguably the biggest challenge of her career".{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/08/natalie-portman-jackie-onassis|title=Natalie Portman: bringing Jackie Onassis back to life|first=Nigel M.|last=Smith|publisher=The Guardian}} Manohla Dargis,{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/01/movies/jackie-review-natalie-portman.html|title='Jackie': Under the Widow's Weeds, a Myth Marketer|date=December 1, 2016|first=Manohla|last=Dargis|publisher=New York Times}} David Edelstein,{{cite news|first=David|last=Edelstein|url=http://www.vulture.com/2016/11/movie-review-jackie.html|title=Jackie Is Brutally Intimate and Admirably Brittle|date=December 1, 2016|publisher=Vulture|quote=Apart from that voice, Portman is so damn smart. She nails Jackie's irreducible mix of shyness and slyness, each quality reinforcing the other. She also understands what the White House refurbishment meant for Jackie's sense of self.}} and Peter Bradshaw{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/jan/19/jackie-review-natalie-portman-kennedy-assassination|title=Jackie review - Natalie Portman intelligent and poised as JFK's widow|date=January 19, 2017|first=Peter|last=Bradshaw|publisher=The Guardian}} praised her performance. news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/av/entertainment-arts-38973904/natalie-portman-on-her-oscar-nomination-for-jackie-role|title=Natalie Portman on her Oscar nomination for Jackie role|date=February 20, {{Infobox person | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1953}} | birth_place = [[Chicago, Illinois]] | nationality = American | residence = Chicago, Illinois | education = B.A. [[Menlo College]] | alma_mater = | occupation = Investor, philanthropist | known_for = co-founder of Commune Hotels & Resorts |networth = {{gain}} US$ 2.5 [[1000000000 (number)|billion]] (October 2018)[https://www.forbes.com/profile/john-pritzker/ Forbes: The World's Billionaires - John Pritzker] June 2015 | spouse = Lisa Stone Pritzker | children = 3 including [[Adam Pritzker]] | parents =[[Jay Pritzker]]
Marian "Cindy" Friend | religion = | website = | family = Nancy Pritzker (sister)
[[Thomas Pritzker]] (brother)
[[Daniel Pritzker]] (brother)
[[Gigi Pritzker|Jean "Gigi" Pritzker]] (sister) }} '''John A. Pritzker''' (born 1953), the grandson of [[A.N. Pritzker]] and son of [[Jay Pritzker]], is an American billionaire and investor. He is a member of the [[Pritzker family]]. ==Early life and education== Pritzker was born to a [[American Jews|Jewish]] family in [[Chicago, Illinois]],[http://www.montereycountyweekly.com/news/cover/article_ebfe3453-8c14-5fd2-bac9-4cf7499e21e7.html Monterey County Weekly: "Hyatt heir John Pritzker's vision of turning Carmel Valley Ranch into an always-open, everyone-welcome version of summer camp" By Josh Sens] may 16, 2013 the son of Marian "Cindy" (née Friend) and Jay Pritzker.[http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/1988/04/25/70462/index.htm CNN Money: "THE PRITZKERS UNVEILING A PRIVATE FAMILY" By Ford S. Worthy] April 25, 1988 Pritzker graduated with a B.A. from [[Menlo College]]. His father diversified the Chicago-based family business, the [[Marmon Group]] - along with his brothers [[Robert Pritzker]] and [[Donald Pritzker]] - building it into a portfolio of over 60 diversified industrial corporations. He also created the [[Hyatt Hotel]] chain in 1957 and owned [[Braniff (1983–1990)|Braniff Airlines]] from 1983–1988. The family has been divesting its assets: in 2006, the family sold Conwood, a smokeless tobacco company, for $3.5 billion to cigarette company [[Reynolds American]] Inc;[http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2011-04-19/business/ct-biz-0420-hyatt-filing-20110419_1_hyatt-founder-jay-pritzker-family-members-majority-stake Chicago Tribune: "Pritzker family could soon own less than half of Hyatt" By Julie Wernau] April 19, 2011 in 2007, the family sold control of the Marmon Group to [[Warren Buffett]]'s [[Berkshire Hathaway]] for $4.5 billion; and in 2010, the family sold its majority stake in [[Transunion]], the Chicago-based credit reporting company, for an undisclosed amount to Chicago-based private-equity firm [[Madison Dearborn Partners]]. ==Career== In 1972, Pritzker started his career working in the family business, Hyatt Hotels, where in 1984, he rose to become Managing Director and Divisional Vice President.[http://www.geolo.com/John_Pritzker Geolo Capital: John Pritzker - Founding Partner and Director] retrieved July 21, 2013 In 1988, he left Hyatt to pursue his own entrepreneurial activities[http://www.wmagazine.com/story/john-pritzker W Magazine: "Pritzker's Prize by Jane Larkworthy] August 2010 including become a founding member of [[Ticketmaster]].[http://www.hotelmanagement.net/one-on-one-with-john-pritzker Hotel Management Magazine: "One on One with John Pritzker" By Ruthanne Terrero] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150610204159/http://www.hotelmanagement.net/one-on-one-with-john-pritzker |date=2015-06-10 }} January 21, 2011 In 1996, he formed [[Mandara Spa]],[http://www.businessweek.com/articles/2012-02-16/a-hyatt-heir-who-thinks-small-is-beautiful BusinessWeek: "A Hyatt Heir Who Thinks Small Is Beautiful" by Nadja Brandt] February 16, 2012 a chain of 72 resort spas, which he hoped to pair up with Hyatt Hotels, but ended up being located entirely in competitors to Hyatt. In 2000, 40% of the company was sold to ''[[Shiseido|Shiseido Co.]]''[http://archives.starbulletin.com/2000/05/16/business/story2.html Honolulu star Bulletin: "Spa firm taps Hawaii for worldwide base" By Russ Lynch] May 16, 2000 In 2001, the remaining 60% was sold to ''Steiner Leisure Limited'', a [[Nasdaq]] (STNR) listed company.[http://www.travelweekly.com/Cruise-Travel/Steiner-Leisure-to-buy-stake-in-Mandara-Spa/ Travel Weekly: "Steiner Leisure to buy stake in Mandara Spa"] July 2, 2001 In 2005, Pritzker founded the private equity firm Geolo Capital with his Mandara business partner Tom Gottlieb; Geolo Capital focused on investments in hospitality, entertainment, and health & wellness companies.[http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2011-12-18/business/ct-biz-1218-pritzkers-family-graphic--20111218_1_primary-residence-three-children-family-tree Chicago Tribune: "The Pritzker family tree" By Melissa Harris and Julie Wernau] December 18, 2011 In 2010, he sold his ownership interest in Hyatt to his family. Geolo Capital purchased a majority interest in the [[Joie de Vivre Hospitality|Joie de Vivre]] boutique hotel chain. In October 2011, he merged the 30 hotel Joie de Vivre chain with the Pomeranc family's 12 hotel Thompson Hotel Group to form [[Commune Hotels & Resorts]][http://www.sfgate.com/business/article/John-Pritzker-Hyatt-heir-likes-boutique-hotels-3341515.php San Francisco Gate: John Pritzker, Hyatt heir, likes boutique hotels" by Nadja Brandt] February 19, 2012 which he co-chairs with [[Jason Pomeranc]]. In 2012, Commune operated 46 hotels and had $450 million in revenues.[http://www.geolo.com/pdf/Commune-SFBizJournalsNov302012.pdf San Francisco Business Journal: "Commune is all inn" by Renée Frojo] November 30, 2012 In January 2016, Commune Hotels merged with Destination Hotels, where Pritzker serves as co-chairman. With the recent merger the new company has over 97 hotels across six brands and annual revenues of over $2.3 billion.{{Cite web|url = http://www.geolo.com|title = Geolo Capital|website = www.geolo.com|access-date = 2016-04-08}} ==Personal life and philanthropy== Pritzker is married to Lisa Stone and they have three children, but they have since filed for divorce.{{Cite web|last1=Harris |first1=Melissa |last2=Wernau |first2=Julie |authorlink= |title=The Pritzker family tree |publisher=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=December 18, 2011 |url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2011-12-18/business/ct-biz-1218-pritzkers-family-graphic--20111218_1_primary-residence-three-children-family-tree |accessdate=}}https://unicourt.com/case/ca-sfc-john-pritzker-vs-lisa-stone-pritzker-480007 Pritzker donated $15 million to the [[University of California at San Francisco]] for new pediatric emergency room facilities at the UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital. The Lisa and John Pritzker Family Fund funds programs focused on children's health and education, civic activities, and Jewish affairs. In 2016, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art completed a $500 million expansion, which includes the Pritzker Center for Photography. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pritzker, John}} [[Category:American people of Ukrainian-Jewish descent]] [[Category:American billionaires]] [[Category:American Jews]] [[Category:Menlo College alumni]] [[Category:Pritzker family|John]] [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{For|the chemist|Carl Scheibler}} {{Infobox person | name = Karl Wilhelm Scheibler | image = Karol Scheibler.jpg | caption = Karl Wilhelm Scheibler | birth_date = {{Birth date|1820|9|1|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Monschau]], [[Prussia]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1881|4|13|1820|9|1|df=y}} | death_place = [[Łódź]], [[Congress Poland]] | other_names = | known_for = | occupation = Industrialist, textile magnate | nationality = [[Germany|German]], [[Poles|Polish]] }} [[File:Monschau-065.JPG|thumb|The "Red House" of Monschau, ancestral home of the Scheibler family]] [[File:2005 Fabrik von Scheibler.gif|thumb|Scheibler's factory at Łódź]] [[File:Kaplica Karola Scheiblera w Łodzi.JPG|thumb|[[Karl Scheibler's Chapel|Scheibler's Mausoleum]] at the Protestant Cemetery of Łódź]] '''Karl Wilhelm Scheibler''' ({{lang-pl|Karol Scheibler}}, 1 September 1820 – 13 April 1881) was a [[Germany|German]]-born [[Poland|Polish]] industrialist, businessman and textile manufacturer.<ref name=Heike>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?lr=&as_brr=0&id=ZecIAQAAIAAJ&dq=heike+otto+textilindustrie&q=medaille|title=Aufbau und Entwicklung der Lodzer Textilindustrie|accessdate=2009-10-02 |work= |publisher= Otto Heike |year=1971 |date= |language=German}}</ref>
== Biography == Scheibler was born in Montjoie (today [[Monschau]]) in the [[Prussia]]n [[Province of Jülich-Cleves-Berg]] into a family of textile fabricants.<ref>[http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSmid=46785965&GRid=13378537& findagrave]</ref> He attended school in Monschau and [[Krefeld]] and received a practical education at his uncle's [[Worsted|Worsted factory]] at [[Verviers]] ([[Belgium]]). In 1839, he worked for [[Société anonyme John Cockerill]], a well known producer of machinery construction at that time.
Because of the riots of the [[Spring of Nations]] in 1848 Scheibler decided to leave Germany and moved to [[Ozorkow]] in [[Congress Poland]], where his uncle, Friedrich Schlösser, had operated a textile factory since 1816. After Schlösser's death he became its commercial director.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=IG3Rp8NAO8EC&pg=PA794&lpg=PA794&dq=karl+wilhelm+scheibler&source=bl&ots=Uddn_skQZA&sig=Hem-Mmlwzb4aQDmRSHD38H8DtJw&hl=de&ei=xuLFSoDwF56MmwPh0pFI&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=8#v=onepage&q=karl%20wilhelm%20scheibler&f=false|title=Deutsche biographische Enzyklopädie|accessdate=2009-10-02 |work= |publisher= Rudolf Vierhaus |year=2007 |date= |language=German}}</ref> Scheibler married Anna née Werner, a niece of Schlösser, on 16 September 1854. In 1852, Scheibler and his partner Julius Schwartz bought a plot at [[Łódź]] and started to build a machinery factory. In October 1854, Schwartz sold his share to Scheibler for 10,000 [[Ruble|rubles]], making him the sole owner of the factory.
In 1855, Scheibler founded a spinning mill with 34 frames and a steam engine of 40 [[horsepower]]. In 1857, Scheibler employed 180 labourers and earned a turnover of 305,100 rubles in 1860. Scheibler made large profits after cotton prices in Europe increased because of the [[American Civil War]] and sold his stock at triple the price.<ref name=EU>[http://www2.warwick.ac.uk/fac/soc/wie/eubuildit/manufacturing/lodz/scheibler/ EUbuildit] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110605082257/http://www2.warwick.ac.uk/fac/soc/wie/eubuildit/manufacturing/lodz/scheibler/ |date=2011-06-05 }}</ref> He became known as the "King of the Cotton and Linen Empires of Łódź".<ref name=Michlic>{{cite web |url=http://www.ces.fas.harvard.edu/publications/docs/pdfs/Michlic.pdf |title=Łódź in the Post-communist Era: In Search of a New Identity|accessdate=2009-10-02 |work=Joanna B. Michlic |publisher= Stockton University|year= |date= |language=}}</ref> In 1870, 1,911 employees worked in his factory, which was the third largest (9.3 percent) cotton producer of Poland.
Scheibler's factory continued to prosper and he bought several smaller mills in the districts of Źarki and Księży Młyn. After a fire destroyed the factory at Księży Młyn in 1874, Scheibler rebuilt it with 88.000 spindles and built his own "Kingdom" of Księży Młyn with houses for 321 families, a fire station, schools, shops and a hospital<ref name=Michlic/><ref>[http://www.migrationsroute.nrw.de/projekt_vorschlag.php?projekt_id=24 migrationsroute.nrw.de]{{de icon}}</ref> Scheibler was known for his social engagement<ref>[http://gim24pitagora.atspace.com/poland/scheibler.html Biography]</ref> and supported the foundation of a municipal credit association, the Commercial Bank of Łódź (Bank Handlowy) in 1872<ref>[http://www.it.pw.edu.pl/muzeum/data/ap151_info.html History of the Bank Handlowy] {{pl icon}}</ref> as well as the construction of a [[Lutheran]] and a [[Catholic]] Church.<ref>[http://www.lodz.ap.gov.pl/fab7.html Biography at State archive Łódź] {{pl icon}}</ref>
In 1880, he transformed his enterprise into a stock corporation with a share capital of 9 million Ruble.<ref>Urząd Miasta Łódź, ''Księży Młyn'', Łódź 1998, p. 23 {{pl icon}}</ref>
Scheibler died on 13 April 1881 in Łódź and was buried at the [[Protestant]] Cemetery of Łódź in a [[Karol Scheibler's Chapel in Łódź|mausoleum]] designed by the Warsaw architects Joseph Dziekonski and Edward Lilop.
== Awards == * 1870 [[Order of the White Eagle (Poland)|Order of the White Eagle]]<ref name=Heike/> * 1876 Gold Medal in [[Warsaw]] * 1878 Great Gold Medal at the [[Exposition Universelle (1878)|Paris World's Fair]] * [[Order of Saint Stanislaus]] First and Second class
== Cultural associations == [[Andrzej Wajda]]'s movie ''[[The Promised Land (1975 film)|The Promised Land]]'' was filmed inside Scheibler's Palace, which is today the location of the Cinematographic Museum of the [[National Film School in Łódź]].<ref name=EU/>
The figure of the German industrialist Heinz Huntze, a character of [[The Brothers Ashkenazi]], is loosely based on Karl Wilhelm Scheibler.
== References == {{Reflist}}

{{refimprove|date=March 2017}}
A '''multilateral exchange''' is a transaction, or forum for transactions, which involve more than two parties.
For example, Alice gives Bob an apple in exchange for an orange, that is a bilateral exchange. A multilateral exchange would involve a third party, for example: Alice gives an apple to Bob who gives an orange to Charles, who gives a pear to Alice.
In the real world, such transactions are spread over time, and involved items of different values, and involve many more parties. A special type of accounting is used for this, called [[mutual credit]], or [[credit clearing]].
==Accounting== Although any accounting framework can be used, there is one approach that fits naturally for multilateral exchange. It is the simplest possible database/spreadsheet design, [[single-entry bookkeeping system|single-entry bookkeeping]] rather than [[Double-entry bookkeeping system|double-entry bookkeeping]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2017}}
All accounts begin with a balance of zero, meaning they owe nothing and are owed nothing. An account may only close at zero, meaning it has given as much as it has received, i.e. that the exchange is complete with respect to all the other accounts. When a transaction happens, an entry is made in an accounting journal of a payment, or credit flowing in the opposite direction.
{| class="wikitable" |- ! #id !! Payee !! Payer !! Amount !! Description |- | 1 || Ann || Bob || 10 || Bob gave Ann an Apple |- | 2 || Bob || Charlie || 5 || Charlie gave Bob an Apricot |- | 3 || Charlie || Ann || 10 || Ann gave Charlie an Orange |- | Volume || || || 15 || |} Account balances are derived by 'adding up' the journal. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Name !! Balance !! Meaning |- | Ann || 0 || Balanced - Ann may close her account |- | Bob || +10-5=5 || Bob is owed (and obliged to take) goods and services to the value of 5 units |- | Charlie || +5-10=-5 || Charlie owes (and is obliged to give) goods and services to the value of 5 units |- | Total || 0 || nothing entered or left this closed system of accounts. |} The sum of all account balances is ''a priori'' [[zero]]. Accounts which close (or are retired) above zero have given more value to the other accounts than they have received and vice versa. Thus a positive balance represents not value *in* the account, but value *owed* to that account by (the aggregate of) all other accounts.
An account's balance in such a system, indicates not the position of the account with respect to past activities with other accounts, but also the activity needed to complete the exchange. thus a balance of +10 means that not only has the account delivered +10 more value to the other members than it has received, but that in order to complete the exchange it intends to receive +10 more in the future than it delivers.
Bob's obligation to spend 5, exactly matches Charlie's obligation to earn 5.
==See also== * [[Mutual credit]] * [[Mutualism (economic theory)]]
==Further reading== * Nikaido, Hukukane, [http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1467-999X.1956.tb00099.x/full "On the classical multilateral exchange problem"], ''Metroeconomica'', vol. 8, iss. 2, pp. 135-145, June 1956. * Ikeo, Aiko, ''A History of Economic Science in Japan'', Routledge, 2014 {{ISBN|1317747534}}. Has extensive discussion of Nikaido's work. * Wood, John Cunningham, ''Karl Marx's Economics: Critical Assessments'', Taylor & Francis, 2004 {{ISBN|0415065100}} (reprint: first published 1988). Discusses multilateral exchange in the context of [[Marxian economics]], pp. 290-293. * Raymond, Ruth; Fowler, Cary, [https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=0VwSLmf5YFkC "Sharing the non-monetary benefits of agricultural biodiversity"], ''[[Issues in Genetic Resources]]'', no. 5, September 2001. Discusses multilateral exchange in the context of agricultural biodiversity.
[[Category:Accounting]]

'''NAXION''' previously known as '''National Analysts Worldwide''', is an American [[market research|marketing research]] company that originally worked as a division of the [[Curtis Publishing Company]]. It was founded by [[Charles Coolidge Parlin]] in 1911. [[Donald M. Hobart]], future head of the division, joined in 1923, though he ended up resigning from the company in 1928 because he desired to work on the selling side of the concept. He was asked to rejoin the company and become the head of the division in 1938 after Parlin had decided to retire.<ref>{{cite journal |author=James Playsted Wood |date=January 1962 |title=Donald M. Hobart |journal=The Journal of Marketing |volume=26 |issue=1 |pages=79–80 |publisher=[[American Marketing Association]] |doi= |pmid= |pmc= |jstor=1249638}}</ref> It is considered to be the "first commercial research company" ever formed.<ref>{{cite book |title=Computer-aided marketing and selling: information asset management |last=Shaw |first=Robert |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=1991 |publisher=Robert Shaw |location= |isbn= 9780750600705|page=80 |pages= |url=https://books.google.com/?id=Y8MAEjyztR4C&pg=PA80&dq=%22Charles+Coolidge+Parlin%22#v=onepage&q=%22Charles%20Coolidge%20Parlin%22&f=false |accessdate=December 30, 2010}}</ref> It became an independent organization in 1943 in order to "provide research services to industry and government."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://nationalanalysts.com/about/corporate-history.asp|title=About Us - Corporate History|author=|date=|work=|publisher=National Analysts Worldwide|accessdate=December 30, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120711020733/http://nationalanalysts.com/about/corporate-history.asp|archivedate=July 11, 2012|df=}}</ref>
== History ==
===As NAXION=== NAXION is the new name for National Analysts Worldwide, a [[market research]]/[[marketing research]] and consulting company.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.naxionthinking.com/about-us/our-history|title=Our History {{!}} NAXION {{!}} Research > Consulting|website=www.naxionthinking.com|access-date=2018-06-21}}</ref> The firm was formed in 1911 when [[Curtis Publishing Company]] hired [[Charles Coolidge Parlin]] to oversee the Division of Commercial Research and conduct research that would help manufacturers understand their customers in the newly emerging [[consumer economy]].<ref>http://www.marketingpower.com/Calendar/Pages/CharlesCoolidgeParlinAward.aspx.</ref><ref>The History of Marketing Thought, Robert Bartels, page 124 - 125.</ref><ref>Market Research and Modeling: Progress and Prospects, Youuram Wind, Paul E. Green, page 246.</ref><ref>History of Qualitative Research Methods in Marketing, page 5.</ref> The goal was to encourage manufacturing companies to make more effective use of advertising in Curtis publications like ''[[The Saturday Evening Post]]'' and ''[[The Ladies Home Journal]]'', both of which would go on to have a major impact on 20th Century popular culture. It is considered to be the "first commercial research company" ever formed.<ref>American Advertising Foundation www.advertisinghalloffame.org/members/member_bio.php?memid=748</ref><ref>Marketing/Research People: Their Behind-th-Scenes Stories, Jack J. Honomichl, page 100.</ref><ref>A New Brand of Business, Douglas B. Ward</ref> It became an independent corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of Curtis in 1943 in order to "provide research services to industry and government." In 1970, it was purchased by [[Booz Allen Hamilton]],<ref>Original Corporate Records, National Analysts Worldwide, Historical Society of Pennsylvania</ref> a consulting firm then seeking to expand its role in the marketing services arena. Two Booz Allen Hamilton officers, Susan Schwartz McDonald and John Berrigan, purchased the firm in 1992, and with Berrigan's retirement in 2004, ownership was restructured as an [[Employee stock ownership plan|ESOP]] under the leadership of McDonald, CEO. In 2006, the firm changed its name to National Analysts Worldwide. In June 2014, the firm changed its name to NAXION to better reflect its expanding 21st century capabilities and affirm its global reach.
Standard techniques like probability sampling, and concepts like focus groups, were either developed at National Analysts or saw some of their earliest application. Select other contributions to the industry include:
:* modern qualitative research techniques including some of the earliest focus groups on record :* predictive modeling techniques
:* optimization modeling :* hierarchical segmentation models and use of multi-criteria cluster techniques :* sampling techniques including invention of Area Probability Sampling<ref>http://www.nationalanalysts.com/about/research-leadership.asp</ref>
===Today=== More than a full century after its inception, NAXION remains headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, and operating as a hybrid marketing research and consulting firm. It employs 80 professionals full time. It consistently ranks amongst the [[Honomichl Top 50]], the largest U.S. research firms.<ref>http://www.marketingpower.com/ResourceLibrary/MarketingNews/Pages/2010/6_30_10/Honomichl_Top_50.aspx</ref> Industries served include: healthcare, pharmaceuticals, communications, technology, media, energy, financial services, residential design, transportation, B2B and consumer products. Service Capabilities include:
:* Brand Strategy :* Demand Forecasting :* Market Surveillance :* Segmentation :* Product Development :* Pricing :* Market Entry Strategy :* Brand Equity Assessment :* Positioning :* Customer Insight
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Market research]]

{{Infobox person | name = Nay Shwe Thway Aung | image = Nay Shwe Thway Aung.jpg | caption = Portrait of Nay Shwe Thway Aung | native_name = {{my|နေရွှေသွေးအောင်}} | native_name_lang = my | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1991|5|22}} | birth_place = [[Yangon]], [[Myanmar]] | nationality = Burmese | other_names = Phoe La Pyae | occupation = [[Business magnate|Business tycoon]] | years_active = | height = | weight = | parents = [[Nay Soe Maung]]
Kyi Kyi Shwe | relatives = {{plainlist| *[[Than Shwe]] {{small|(grandfather)}} *[[Kyaing Kyaing]] {{small|(grandmother)}} }} | awards = | website = | religion = | other name = | nickname = | background = | }} '''Nay Shwe Thway Aung''' ({{lang-my|နေရွှေသွေးအောင်}}, also known as '''Phoe La Pyae'''; born 22 May 1991) is a Burmese [[Business magnate|business tycoon]]{{cite web|url=http://www.burmapartnership.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/The-Regime_s-Cronies-List-June-27_-2011_-Final.pdf|title=Partial List of Cronies Who Provide Political and Financial Support for Burma’s Ruling Regime; Prepared by Aung Din, U.S. Campaign for Burma, June 2011/Nay Shwe Thway Aung No.28|work=burmapartnership.org|date=|accessdate=12 October 2017|language=en}}, the grandson of Senior General [[Than Shwe]], Myanmar's dictator and formerly head of a military junta. He is one of the business [[tycoon]] in the list of cronies who provide political and financial support for Burma's ruling regime and government.{{Cite news|url=http://www2.irrawaddy.com/article.php?art_id=20361|title=Senior General's Grandson Orders Attack on Business Rival|date=21 December 2010|work=[[The Irrawaddy]]|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://www2.irrawaddy.com/article.php?art_id=16843|title=Than Shweâ€™s Grandson: Geek, Playboy or Gangster?|date=23 September 2009|work=[[The Irrawaddy]]|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-35023921|title=What a signed banknote tells us about Myanmar's next leadership|date=7 December 2015|work=[[BBC News]]|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.mmtimes.com/national-news/7462-rumours-of-model-and-than-shwe-s-grandson-eloping-untrue.html|title=Rumours of model and Than Shwe's grandson eloping untrue|date=11 July 2013|work=[[The Myanmar Times]]|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://www2.irrawaddy.com/print_article.php?art_id=17397|title=Burmese Media Lead with Than Shwe's Favorites|date=14 December 2009|work=[[The Irrawaddy]]|access-date=|language=en}} ==Early life and family== Nay Shwe Thway Aung was born in [[Yangon]] at the ruling family of Myanmar.{{Cite news|url=http://www.myanmar-image.com/topic/myanmar-dictator|title=Burmese dictator|date=|work=Myanmar Image|access-date=|language=en}} He is the only son of [[Nay Soe Maung]], a Army doctor and his wife Kyi Kyi Shwe, a daughter of Dictator [[Than Shwe]]. He attended high school at [[Practising School Yangon Institute of Education]] and enrolled in [[West Yangon Technological University]].{{Cite news|url=http://www2.irrawaddy.com/article.php?art_id=9890&Submit=Submit|title=University Privileges Granted to Than Shwe's Grandson|date=9 January 2008|work=[[The Irrawaddy]]|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://books.google.com.mm/books?id=KkgPBAAAQBAJ&pg=PT78&lpg=PT78&dq=nay+shwe+thway+aung+is+the&source=bl&ots=rxLLBjXybL&sig=KeDSLqAgtz4D_MCZnJw-JKageiQ&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjTptv3tJ_WAhXFJZQKHaMEAM04ChDoAQg0MAc#v=onepage&q=nay%20shwe%20thway%20aung%20is%20the&f=false|title=Nay Shwe Thway Aung Biography|date=|work=Than Shwe: Unmasking Burma’s Tyrant-Google Book|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.irrawaddy.com/news/burma/publisher-sidelines-ceo-alleged-threats-shwes-grandson.html|title=Publisher Sidelines CEO Who Alleged Threats by Than Shwe's Grandson|date=21 October 2013|work=[[The Irrawaddy]]|access-date=|language=en}} ==Business holding== Nay Shwe Thway Aung is the Major broker between the regime officials and businesspersons. He has earned a reputation as the most notorious member of the ruling family. He has been accused of ordering military officers serving as his assistants to carry out attacks on business rivals, and even top generals are said to be wary of displeasing him.{{Cite news|url=http://www2.irrawaddy.com/article.php?art_id=20396|title=Than Shwe's Son-in-law Named Ambassador to China|date=23 December 2010|work=[[The Irrawaddy]]|access-date=|author=Wai Moe|language=en}} Nay Shwe Thway Aung had close ties to key figure with business tycoon [[Zaw Zaw]]. Through his relationships, Zaw Zaw have won concessions and import licenses, including most of the country's car and motorcycle import licenses, as well as import and distribution licenses for fuel. According to business sources in Yangon, Nay Shwe Thway Aung took a new [[Mercedes Benz]] from a warehouse of the military-owned [[Union of Myanmar Economic Holdings|Union of Myanmar Economic Holding, Ltd]] (UMEHL), paying just 10 million kyat (US $11,600) for a luxury vehicle valued at least 200 million kyat ($230,000) in Burma. In January 2009, Nay Shwe Thway Aung has plan to buying one of the world's most popular football clubs, [[Manchester United]] football team for US $1 billion, according to US diplomatic cables revealed by [[WikiLeaks]], but he reportedly abandoned the plan, because such an investment only months after nearly 150,000 people were killed by [[Cyclone Nargis]], was deemed inappropriate.{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/dec/06/wikileaks-burma-manchester-united-takeover|title=WikiLeaks cables: Burma general considered Manchester United buyout|date=6 December 2010|work=The Guardian News|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2011/SPORT/football/03/21/soccer.wikileaks.manchester.myanmar/index.html|title=Soccerleaks: The football files|date=21 March 2011|publisher=[[CNN]] |access-date=|language=en}} ==Dictator post== Nay Shwe Thway Aung was hoped heir pretender to the dictator of Burma, and will take his grandfather Than Shwe's chair and ruling authority by Burmese peoples.{{cite web|url=http://celekabar.com/%E1%80%96%E1%80%AD%E1%80%AF%E1%80%B8%E1%80%9C%E1%80%BB%E1%80%95%E1%80%8A%E1%80%B9%E1%80%B7-%E1%80%81-%E1%80%B1%E1%80%94%E1%80%B1%E1%80%9B%E1%82%8A%E1%80%B1%E1%80%9E%E1%80%BC%E1%80%B8%E1%80%B1/|title=ဖိုးလပြည့် (ခ) နေရွှေသွေးအောင် ပြောတဲ့ သူနဲ့သူ၏မေမေအကြောင်း|work=Cele Kabar|date=20 April 2018|accessdate=30 April 2018|language=my}}{{cite web|url=https://www.globalwitness.org/documents/18154/Jade_full_report_online_low_res.pdf|title=Myanmar's "Big State Secret"|work=Global Witness|date=|accessdate=5 April 2018|language=en}} In his 20th Birthday, Nay Shwe Thway Aung said "I will not succeed ruling authority from my grandfather [[Than Shwe]]."{{cite web|url=https://burma.irrawaddy.com/news/2011/11/16/2395.html |title=နေရွှေသွေးအောင် အကြောင်း|work=[[The Irrawaddy]]|date=16 November 2011|accessdate=30 April 2018|language=my}} In 2011, Than Shwe officially stepped down as head of state in favour of his hand-picked successor, [[Thein Sein]] to [[President of Burma]]. In 4 December 2015, Nay Shwe Thway Aung and his grandfather [[Than Shwe]] met with [[Aung San Suu Kyi]] as the future leader of the country and that he pledged to support her if she works for the development of the country.{{Cite news|url=http://mizzimaburmese.com/article/7946|title=“ဒေါ်အောင်ဆန်းစုကြည်၊ ဖိုးလပြည့်နဲ့ သတင်းမီဒီယာ လောက”|date=20 November 2015|work=[[Mizzima News]]|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://mizzimaburmese.com/article/7900|title=တိုင်းပြည်အတွက် ကျရာကဏ္ဍက ကူညီမယ်လို့ ဖိုးလပြည့်ပြော |date=26 November 2015|work=[[Mizzima News]]|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.cogitasia.com/president-aung-san-suu-kyi-probably-not-yet/|title=President Aung San Suu Kyi? Probably Not Yet|date=15 December 2015|work=cogitAsia|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://mizzimaburmese.com/article/7879|title=ဖိုးလပြည့်နှင့် တွေ့ဆုံခဲ့ဟု ဒေါ်အောင်ဆန်းစုကြည် အတည်ပြု|date=26 November 2015|work=[[Mizzima News]]|access-date=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://democracyforburma.wordpress.com/2015/11/26/myanmar-grandson-of-than-shwe-met-daw-aung-san-suu-kyi/|title=Grandson of ex-dictator snr-gen Than Shwe has met Daw Aung San Suu Kyi|date=|work=Democracy for burma|access-date=|language=en}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *{{Facebook|100000214478693}} *[http://www.burmapartnership.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/The-Regime_s-Cronies-List-June-27_-2011_-Final.pdf Partial List of Cronies Who Provide Political and Financial Support for Burma’s Ruling Regime : Nay Shwe Thway Aung No.28] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nay Shwe Thway Aung}} [[Category:Burmese businesspeople]] [[Category:1991 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Yangon]]

{{Underlinked|date=June 2018}}
The '''Network of Executive Women''' (NEW) is a women's leadership organization serving the [[retail]], consumer goods, financial services and technology industries. It represents more than 11,000 members from 850 companies, 100 corporate partners and 21 regions in the U.S. and Canada.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newonline.org/annualreport|title=NEW Annual Report 2018|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=May 7, 2018}}</ref>
== Mission == NEW's mission is to advance all women and create a better workplace for everyone through research, advocacy, leadership development and organizational change.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.newonline.org/about-us/mission-vision|title=NEW Mission & Vision|last=|first=|date=May 7, 2018|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=May 7, 2018}}</ref>
== Leadership == Sarah Alter — named president and CEO of NEW in June 2017 — has wide-ranging experience in the retail, financial services and technology markets. As vice president of Discover Financial Services, she led the product strategy for all credit card features, benefits and services. As vice president for digital sales and marketing at Quill.com, Alter helped expand digital sales for office supply company Staples. As chief marketing officer for General Growth Properties, Alter developed and executed marketing strategies for 200 shopping mall properties and their top retailers. Alter has served on a number of non-profit boards and has been an organizer of Chicago's annual JDRF Gala, which raised millions of dollars for Type 1 diabetes. She is a graduate of Northwestern University and has a Harvard MBA.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://csnews.com/network-executive-women-appoints-new-ceo|title=Network of Executive Women Appoints New CEO|last=|first=|date=|work=Convenience Store News|access-date=May 7, 2018}}</ref>
Other NEW leaders include Board Chair Lisa Walsh, CEO of Truco Enterprises, Immediate Past Board Chair Karen Stuckey of Walmart Inc., Vice Chair Monica Turner of Procter & Gamble, Treasurer Erby Foster of Foster Inclusion and Secretary Regenia Stein of Ingenuity Consulting. The Board's Executive Committee also includes Audit Chair Dagmar Boggs of 7-Eleven, Compensation Chair Karen Mooney, Regional Advisory Chair Elizabeth Marrion of Accenture, and Transformation Chair Vicki Felker of Nestlé Purina PetCare.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/new-names-7-executives-to-board-lisa-walsh-of-truco-enterprises-will-chair-300589351.html|title=NEW names 7 executives to its board; Lisa Walsh of Truco Enterprises will chair|last=|first=|date=January 28, 2018|website=PR Newswire|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=May 7, 2018}}</ref>
== Research and insights == NEW conducts independent research and partners with other organizations to produce insights to help companies achieve gender equality and inclusion. NEW released "The Female Leadership Crisis: Why Women Are Leaving (and What We Can Do About It)" in February 2018 with Mercer & Co and Accenture.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bizjournals.com/chicago/prnewswire/press_releases/Illinois/2018/03/20/UN43302|title=Turnover Much Higher for Women than Men in Retail and Consumer Goods, Study Finds|last=|first=|date=|work=Chicago Business Journal|access-date=https://www.bizjournals.com/chicago/prnewswire/press_releases/Illinois/2018/03/20/UN43302}}</ref>
== Regional groups == The Network of Executive Women has 21 regional groups in the United States and Canada that provide local events, outreach and services to the communities where NEW members and supporters live and work.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.newonline.org/findregion|title=NEW Regions|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=May 7, 2018}}</ref>
* Atlanta * Carolinas * Chicago * Cincinnati * Denver * Florida * Greater Philadelphia * Idaho * Mid-Atlantic * New England * New York Metro * North Texas * Northern California * Northwest Arkansas * Pacific Northwest * Phoenix * Southern California * South Texas * Toronto * Twin Cities * Western Michigan
== History == NEW founders held organizational meetings in Atlanta, New York and elsewhere in 2000-2001, and the Network of Executive Women was incorporated April 1, 2001. Five thousand dollars in seed money was provided by The Minute Maid Company (then CEO Don Knauss was an early Champion; Ahold USA CEO Bill Grize was one of the first retail leaders to lend his support). NEW held a kick-off meeting at the FMI Midwinter Executive Conference, January 22, 2001, and NEW's first official meeting was held April 2, 2001 in New York City. On June 1, 2001, NEW held its second official meeting and elected its first Board and Officer slate.
== References == <references />
== External links == * [http://www.newonline.org/ Network of Executive Women]
__INDEX__

{{BLP sources|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = | name = Owais Muzaffar Tappi
{{small|{{Nastaliq|اویس مظفر}}}} | honorific_suffix = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | disappeared_date = | disappeared_place = | disappeared_status = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | monuments = | residence = Karachi, Pakistan | nationality = [[Pakistan]]i | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = [[Bachelor of Commerce]]{{cite web|title=Nomination Form PS-88|url=http://ecp.gov.pk/ScanNF/PA/PS/PS-88/AWAIS%20MUZAFAR.pdf|publisher=Election Commission of Pakistan|accessdate=13 April 2013}} | alma_mater = | occupation = Politician, Business | years_active = | employer = | organization = | agent = | known_for = | notable_works = | style = | influences = | influenced = | home_town = | salary = | net_worth = | height = | weight = | television = | title = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = [[Pakistan Peoples Party|PPP]] | movement = | opponents = | boards = | denomination = | criminal_charge = | criminal_penalty = | criminal_status = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | callsign = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | signature_size = | module = | module2 = | module3 = | module4 = | module5 = | module6 = | website = | footnotes = | box_width = }} {{Contains Urdu text}} '''Owais Muzaffar''' ({{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|اویس مظفر}}}}, {{lang-sd|اویس مظفر}}) is the adopted son of [[Hakim Ali Zardari]] and the foster-brother of Pakistan’s former President [[Asif Ali Zardari]]. Owais Muzaffar's biological father worked for [[Hakim Ali Zardari]] as manager of [[Bambino Cinema]] in Karachi.{{cite news|last=Mahmood|first=Rafay|title=Bambino: Dust in the wind?|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/176595/bambino-dust-in-the-wind/|accessdate=13 April 2013|newspaper=The Express Tribune|date=26 May 2011}} In 1995, he was appointed as [[Pakistan Administrative Service|Deputy District Officer DDO (Revenue)]] in PCS, [[Sindh Public Service Commission]]. Muzzaffar was considered de facto Chief Minister of Sindh, during the reign of PPP Chief Minister Qaim Ali Shah.{{cite news|last=Abbasi|first=Ansar|title=Tappi: de facto chief minister of Sindh|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/todaysprintdetail.aspx?id=17200&cat=2&dt=1/1/2011|accessdate=13 April 2013|newspaper=The News|date=25 November 2010}}{{cite news|last=Abbasi|first=Ansar|title=Zardari’s friend rules Sindh through CM’s new secy|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-13-3039-Zardaris-friend-rules-Sindh-through-CMs-new-secy|accessdate=13 April 2013|newspaper=The News|date=31 December 2010}} During the Pakistan General Elections 2013, Muzaffar contested for and won the Sindh assembly elections from constituency PS-88 Thatta. He secured 28,593 votes, while his opponent Haji Muhammad Usman Malkani got 20,997.{{cite web|title=PS-88 (THATTA-V) Result|url=http://ecp.gov.pk/electionresult/Search.aspx?constituency=PA&constituencyid=PS-88|publisher=[[Election Commission of Pakistan]]|accessdate=21 May 2013}}{{cite news|title=Owais Muzaffar wins from PS-88|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/548070/owais-muzaffar-wins-from-ps-88/|newspaper=[[The Express Tribune]]|accessdate=21 May 2013|date=12 May 2013}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Muzaffar, Owais}} [[Category:1965 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Pakistan Peoples Party politicians]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Sindh]] [[Category:Pakistani businesspeople]] [[Category:Pakistani expatriates in the United Arab Emirates]] [[Category:Pakistani landowners]] [[Category:People from Dubai]] [[Category:Sindhi people]] [[Category:Politicians from Karachi]] [[Category:Sindh MPAs 2013–18]] [[Category:Zardari family]]

{{Orphan|date=April 2015}} {{Infobox writer | name = Pedro De Abreu | image = Pedro De Abreu in Dubai.jpg | image_size = 220px | caption = De Abreu at a book signing in Dubai | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1989|07|14}} | birth_place = [[Brasília]], [[Federal District (Brazil)|DF]], Brazil | nationality = [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]]
[[American people|American]] | occupation = Entrepreuner • educator • author | alma_mater = [[Harvard University]]
[[University of South Carolina]] | website = {{URL|http://pedrodeabreu.com}} | awards = {{unbulleted list| Harvard University Leadership in Education Award | Coca-Cola New Century Scholar | All-SC Academic Team | Darla Moore Emerging Leader | Fulbright Fellowship Finalist| Walker Institute Scholar | Magellan Scholar}} }} '''Pedro de Abreu''' (born July 14, 1989) is a [[Brazilian American]] entrepreneur, educator, and author. He was the co-founder of a multi-media company in Hollywood, California, and the founder and director of the [[nonprofit organization]] Check Mate Foundation.{{cite web |url= http://www.wltx.com/news/article/138076/2/Math-Science-English-and-Chess- |title=Math, Science, English, and Chess? |publisher= wltx.com |date=2011-05-26 |accessdate=2012-03-04}}http://www.moore.sc.edu/news.aspx?article_id=326 De Abreu directs the Brain and Cognitive Science thematic at the AI Initiative. http://ai-initiative.org/applications/brain-cognitive-science/ De Abreu was published in a book by [[Marshall Cavendish]], a subsidiary company to the [[Times Publishing Company|Times Publishing Group]], among 25 young entrepreneurs from around the world.{{cite web | url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Young-Entrepreneur-World-Teen-trepreneurs-Scratching/dp/9814361097 | title=Young Entrepreneur World: How 25 Teen-trepreneurs Succeeded and Left World Leaders Scratching Their Heads [Paperback] | accessdate=2012-07-21}}http://www.tedxcolumbiasc.com/pedro-de-abreu/ ==Early life and education== De Abreu was born in [[Brasília]], [[Federal District (Brazil)|Distrito Federal]], and grew up on the coastal city of [[João Pessoa, Paraíba|João Pessoa]], [[Paraíba]], where he experienced poverty and struggled to get by as a teenager.http://gandbmagazine.com/mag/portraits He moved to America in 2005 without knowing how to speak English. He became fluent in one year and was placed into [[Advanced Placement]] classes, including English, European history and psychology.{{cite web |url= http://www.midlandsbiz.com/articles/8104/ |title=Pedro De Abreu, Recent Midlands Tech Graduate, Spoke to St. Andrews Rotary Club |publisher=midlandsbiz.com |date=2011-06-04 |accessdate=2012-03-04}} He graduated from Chapin High School and [[Midlands Technical College]] before attending the [[Moore School of Business]] at the [[University of South Carolina]], focusing his work on [[economics]]. De Abreu subsequently attended [[Harvard University]], where he attained a master's degree in an emerging [[science|scientific]] field that brings together [[cognitive neuroscience]], [[developmental cognitive neuroscience]], [[educational psychology]], [[education theory]] and other related disciplines to explore the interactions between biological processes and practice.{{cite journal | last1 = Ansari | first1 = D | authorlink1 = | last2 = Coch | first2 = D | year = 2006 | title = Bridges over troubled waters: Education and cognitive neuroscience | journal = Trends in Cognitive Sciences | volume = 10 | issue = 4 | pages = 146–151 | publisher = Elsevier Science | doi = 10.1016/j.tics.2006.02.007 | pmid = 16530462}}{{cite journal | last1 = Coch | first1 = D | authorlink1 = | last2 = Ansari | first2 = D | year = 2008 | title = Thinking about mechanisms is crucial to connecting neuroscience and education | journal = Cortex | volume = 45 | issue = 4 | pages = 546–547 | publisher = Elsevier Science | doi = 10.1016/j.cortex.2008.06.001 | pmid = 18649878}} ==Awards== At Harvard, De Abreu received the prestigious Leadership in Education Award, a merit-based fellowship given to top master's degree candidates with strong leadership potential.http://www.gse.harvard.edu/admissions/financial_aid/fellowships/meritbased.html#ixzz2zP1Ojqrshttp://midlandsbiz.whosonthemove.com/pressreleases/darla-moore-school-business-graduate-pedro-de-abreu-finalist-2016-forbes-30-30/http://www.prlog.org/12523651-pedro-de-abreu-14x-innovation-group-ceo-finalist-in-the-2016-forbes-30-under-30-list.html De Abreu is South Carolina's New Century Scholar, an award given by [[Phi Theta Kappa]], [[USA Today]] and the [[Coca-Cola Foundation]] to the state's top student.http://www.ptk.org/schol/recipients/2011/newcentury.php{{cite web|url=http://www.ccjournal-digital.com/ccjournal/20110405online?pg=72#pg72 |title=Community College Journal - April/May 2011 |publisher=Ccjournal-digital.com |date=2011-03-29 |accessdate=2012-03-04}}{{cite web|url=http://www.communitycollegetimes.com/Pages/Funding/2011-Coca-Cola-scholars.aspx |title=2011 New Century Scholars |publisher=Communitycollegetimes.com |date=2011-05-04 |accessdate=2012-03-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120314062317/http://www.communitycollegetimes.com/Pages/Funding/2011-Coca-Cola-scholars.aspx |archivedate=March 14, 2012 }} De Abreu is a Walker Institute and Magellan Scholar, City of Columbia Fellow, and the recipient of the C. Russell Hill Memorial Scholarship for Economics.http://www.midlandsbiz.com/articles/11534/ The latter for his research titled "The Development of Empathy, Leadership and Pro-Social Dispositions in Middle-School and High School Age Children: A Case Study of Peer Education and the Anne Frank Story in Brazil." http://www.ed.sc.edu/News.asp?article=1092{{cite web|url=http://www.sc.edu/provost/leadership/program/index.shtml |title=Leadership - Office of the Provost |publisher=Sc.edu |date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2012-03-04}}{{cite web|url=http://mooreschool.sc.edu/news.aspx?article_id=278 |title=News | The Moore School of Business | University of South Carolina |publisher=Mooreschool.sc.edu |date=2011-10-21 |accessdate=2012-03-04}} ==Government== In April 2014, De Abreu was appointed to serve on the board of directors of the Central Midlands Council of Governments(CMCOG), one of the most influential councils in [[South Carolina]], assisting local governments develop local and regional plans within four midlands counties ([[Fairfield County, South Carolina|Fairfield]], [[Lexington County, South Carolina|Lexington]], [[Newberry]], [[Richland County, South Carolina|Richland]]), as well as providing local governments with planning and technical support to improve the quality of life within the regions. CMCOG currently consists of 14 member governments in its board of directors, and serves in excess of 725,000 people. http://centralmidlands.org/about-us/board-members.htmlhttp://centralmidlands.org/wp-content/uploads/6.26.14_Board-Meeting-Agenda-Packet.o.pdfhttp://www.richlandonline.com/Portals/0/Departments/CountyCouncil/Minutes/Reg%2004-15-14.pdf ==Social Entrepreneur== ===Nonprofit=== In [[South Carolina]], De Abreu started the non-profit Check Mate Foundation, which focuses on teaching [[chess]] and leadership to children with disabilities and also to [[underprivileged children]]. In an interview in 2011, he said: "Chess is just really a medium through which we try to implement leadership and character... Chess will never be on the SAT. But the patience, analytical skills, the thinking skills, the ability to do those things will be skills that will be forever in demand."http://www.wltx.com/news/story.aspx?storyid=138076 In another interview, he stated: "Studies have shown that chess develops logical thinking, improves concentration and promotes imagination, creativity and independence."http://www.sc.edu/news/newsarticle.php?nid=2069#.UbLpokCTi90 As a speaker, De Abreu was represented internationally by [[Sabirul Islam]]'s Teen Speakers International Bureau.{{cite web|url=http://www.teen-speakers.com/?p=251 |title=Pedro De Abreu |publisher=Teen-speakers.com |date=2011-10-11 |accessdate=2012-03-04}}[[File:De Abreu at TEDxColumbiaSC.jpg|thumb|De Abreu at TEDx]]De Abreu has spoken in countries like [[Dubai]], [[Oman]], [[Kuwait]], [[Bahrain]] and [[Brazil]], and at [[TEDx]].http://leanblitz.net/2013/01/a-visit-to-tedxcolumbiasc/http://www.sc.edu/news/newsarticle.php?nid=5271#.UbLum0CTi90https://www.ted.com/tedx/events/6478https://www.facebook.com/tedxyouthcolumbiasc/photos/pb.337793959590789.-2207520000.1397975724./676295039074011/?type=3&theater ====Author==== In 2011, De Abreu published his first book, detailing the hardshipshttp://theindiechicks.com/spotlights/from-hardship-to-stages-around-the-world-pedro-de-abreu/ he had to overcome in [[Brazil]] due to the lack of opportunity, and in [[United States of America|America]] for not being able to speak English on his arrival, as well as practical steps one can take to achieve meaningful change. Author Scott Simson said that his book is "a must read for anyone wanting to advance their life."https://www.amazon.com/The-ABC-SUCCESS-Series-ebook/dp/B006Z06WTM De Abreu writes a monthly column for [[Richard Branson]]'s [[Virgin Group|Virgin]] on the topics of science, innovation, entrepreneurship, and public speaking.http://www.virgin.com/author/pedro-de-abreu In 2012, De Abreu was featured on Young Entrepreneur World: How 25 Teen-Trepreneurs Succeeded and Left World Leaders Scratching Their Heads, published by British publisher [[Marshall Cavendish]], a [[subsidiary company]] of [[Times Publishing Group]], the printing and publishing subsidiary of [[Singapore]]-based conglomerate [[Fraser and Neave]]. '''Academia''' De Abreu is a Teaching Fellow at the [[Harvard Graduate School of Education]].https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/8690/pages/syllabus He facilitates the Management Development Program at the [[Harvard Graduate School of Education]] and the Mind, Brain, Behavior Interfaculty Thesis Workshops for graduating seniors at Harvard College. De Abreu is the Director of the Artificial Intelligence, Brain, and Cognitive Sciences thematic at the [[AI Initiative]].http://www.scetv.org/blog/carolina-money/2016/qa-conversation-usc-and-harvard-alumnus-pedro-de-abreu-finalist-2016-forbes ==Television== De Abreu hosted a biweekly segment on [[WLTX]], a [[CBS]]-affiliated television station, called The Motivational Minute, on motivation and leadership.http://www.wltx.com/video/2615784684001/1/Your-Motivational-Minute-with-Pedro-de-Abreuhttp://midlandsbiz.com/articles/15176/ ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==Further reading== * {{cite web |url=http://www.sctechsystem.com/news/ptk2011.html |title=SC Technical College System honors Phi Theta Kappa All-State Academic Team Members |work=sctechsystem.com |publisher=SC State Board for Technical and Comprehensive Education |accessdate=Nov 20, 2011}} * {{cite book |last=Islam |first=Sabirul |title=Young Entrepreneur World: How 25 Teen-Trepreneurs Succeeded and Left World Leaders Scratching Their Heads |publisher=[[Marshall Cavendish]] |date=15 February 2012 |isbn=978-981-4361-09-5}} ==External links== * {{Official website|pedrodeabreu.com/}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abreu, Pedro de}} [[Category:1989 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Brasília]] [[Category:Brazilian businesspeople]] [[Category:Brazilian emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:American businesspeople]] [[Category:American motivational speakers]] [[Category:University of South Carolina alumni]] [[Category:Harvard Graduate School of Education alumni]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.1) ([[User:Balon Greyjoy|Balon Greyjoy]])
revision.text:
'''Pietro Ferrero''' (11 September 1963{{spaced ndash}}18 April 2011)<ref>{{cite web|author=18 aprile 2011 |url=http://www.ilsole24ore.com/art/notizie/2011-04-18/morto-pietro-ferrero-gruppo-181547.shtml?uuid=AaWe8yPD |title=È morto Pietro Ferrero, ceo del gruppo di Alba |publisher=Il Sole 24 ORE |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/story/2011/04/18/ferrero-head-dies-car-crash.html |title=Ferrero chocolate CEO dies in accident - World - CBC News |website=Cbc.ca |date=2011-04-18 |accessdate=2016-05-19}}</ref> was the joint CEO (with his brother [[Giovanni Ferrero|Giovanni]]) of Italian confectionery company [[Ferrero SpA]], from 1997 until his death in April 2011.<ref name="nytimes">{{cite news | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/04/19/business/19ferrero.html | title=Pietro Ferrero, Food Company Scion, Dies at 47 | newspaper=[[The New York Times]] | date=18 April 2011 | accessdate=23 April 2011 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5y9AKjCey?url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/04/19/business/19ferrero.html?_r=1 | archivedate=23 April 2011 | deadurl=yes | df= }}</ref>
[[File:Pietro Ferrero Jr memorial stone PNG.png|thumb|upright|Pietro Ferrero Jr (1963-2011) memorial at the Pietro Ferrero lookout point in Cape Town]]
Ferrero was born in [[Turin]], the elder son of [[Michele Ferrero]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/Ferrero-SpA-Company-History.html |title=History of Ferrero SpA – FundingUniverse |website=Fundinguniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}}</ref> who raised the firm to its position as a global leader.<ref>{{cite web|last=Jassiem |first=Nurene |url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/ferrero-dies-in-sa-1.1058843 |title=Ferrero dies in SA |publisher=IOL |date=2011-04-19 |accessdate=2016-05-19}}</ref> In 1985, he began working for Ferrero, and in 1992 had risen to be in charge of European operations.<ref name="nytimes"/> He became one of the company's two CEOs in 1997, along with his brother [[Giovanni Ferrero|Giovanni]].<ref name="nytimes"/>
On 18 April 2011, Pietro Ferrero died in [[South Africa]] near Twelve Apostles Hotel in [[Camps Bay]], suburb of [[Cape Town]]<ref name="BSkyB">{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/Article/201009115974933|title=Ferrero Rocher Chocolate Tycoon Pietro Ferrero Dies In Biking Accident In South Africa |work=[[British Sky Broadcasting]]|accessdate=18 April 2011}}</ref> after fainting and falling off his bike.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://eatocracy.cnn.com/2011/04/18/ferrero-ceo-dies-in-accident/?hpt=T2 | title=Chocolate company CEO Pietro Ferrero dies in biking accident | publisher=CNN | date=18 April 2011 | accessdate=23 April 2011 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5y9AfayAP?url=http://eatocracy.cnn.com/2011/04/18/ferrero-ceo-dies-in-accident/ | archivedate=23 April 2011 | deadurl=yes | df= }}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Ferrero, Pietro, Jr.}} [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:2011 deaths]] [[Category:Businesspeople in confectionery]] [[Category:Italian businesspeople]] [[Category:Ferrero family]]
{{Italy-business-bio-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox hotel | hotel_name = Radisson Hotel Baltimore Downtown-Inner Harbor | logo = | logo_width = | image = 2008 05 07 - Baltimore - W Baltimore St looking toward N Liberty St.JPG | caption = In 2008, as the Sheraton Baltimore City Center | location = [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]] | address = 101 West Fayette Street | chain = [[Radisson Hotels]] | coordinates = {{coord|39|17|24|N|76|37|2|W|region:US-MD_type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | opening_date = July 15, 1967 | developer = | architect = [[William B. Tabler]] | operator = [[Radisson Hotels]] | cost = | owner = | number_of_rooms = 706 | number_of_suites = | number_of_restaurants= | floor_area = | floors = | height = | parking = | website = [http://www.radisson.com/baltimore-hotel-md-21201/usabhmd] | footnotes = }} [[Image:2008 05 07 - Baltimore - View above Hanover St 1.jpg|thumb|left|The two towers of the hotel]] The '''Radisson Hotel Baltimore Downtown-Inner Harbor''' is a [[high-rise]] hotel complex located in [[Baltimore, Maryland]]. The complex contains two nearly identical towers, rising to 302 feet/92 meters, containing 27 floors and making them among the [[List of tallest buildings in Baltimore|tallest buildings in Baltimore]].
==History== The hotel opened as '''The Statler Hilton Baltimore''' on July 15, 1967<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/219159321/|title=The Baltimore Sun from Baltimore, Maryland on July 9, 1967 · 133|website=Newspapers.com|accessdate=9 July 2018}}</ref> with one tower, containing 352 rooms.<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2006-03-16/business/0603160082_1_sheraton-inner-harbor-convention-hotel-sheraton-city-center|title=Baltimore will have two Sheraton hotels|website=Articles.baltimoresun.com|accessdate=9 July 2018}}</ref> The Statler Hilton was a part of the Charles Center urban renewal project. The sponsors and developers, the Hilton Hotels Corporation and the Metropolitan Structures, Inc., signed a contract on July 25, 1964. The hotel was expected to cost $12 million and to contain 500 to 800 rooms in two towers. The first tower was scheduled to be completed by mid-1966.<ref>"Baltimore to Get Theater and Hotel." ''The New York Times'', July 26, 1964. Proquest Historical Newspaper: The New York Times with index, pg. 34. (accessed December 7, 2015).</ref> The head architect of the project was [[William B. Tabler]]; a famous hotel architect who designed Hiltons throughout the country.<ref>''Encyclopedia of Architecture: Design, Engineering, and Construction,'' s.v. "Tabler, William B," Vol 5. (New York: John Wiley & Sons, 1990.)</ref> The second tower was a later addition.
The hotel eventually became the '''Baltimore Hilton'''. In 1984, it was renamed the '''Omni International Baltimore''', in 2000 the '''Wyndham Baltimore''', in 2006 the '''Sheraton Baltimore City Center''',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hotel-online.com/News/PR2006_1st/Mar06_BaltimoreSheraton.html|title=Columbia Sussex Planning to Rebrand the 707 room Wyndham Baltimore Inner Harbor to Sheraton; Reflagging Will Be the Hotel's Fourth Brand |date=1 March 2006|website=Hotel-online.com|accessdate=9 July 2018}}</ref> on May 29, 2014 the '''Baltimore Harbor Hotel''', and on May 18, 2016 the '''Radisson Hotel Baltimore Downtown-Inner Harbor'''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hotelnewsresource.com/article89356.html|title=Radisson Hotel Baltimore Downtown-Inner Harbor Hotel Opens|first=Hotel News|last=Resource|website=Hotelnewsresource.com|accessdate=9 July 2018}}</ref>
The hotel was the site of a 1980 Presidential debate between [[Ronald Reagan]] and [[John B. Anderson]].<ref name=autogenerated1 /> TV
It also played host to the first WWE (then WWF) Hall of Fame induction ceremony.
The North Tower has 23 floors and the South Tower (which is now a separate '''Crowne Plaza Hotel''') has 27 floors.

{{notability|Biographies|date=February 2014}} {{Infobox person |birth_place=[[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]] |birth_date={{birth date and age|1969|11|11|mf=yes}} |occupation=businessman }}
'''Roger Vincent Hardy''' (born November 11, 1969) is a Canadian [[Internet entrepreneur]] and businessman. He is the Chairman, and CEO of Hardy Capital.<ref>Tilak, John [http://www.businessinsider.com/r-canadas-hardy-capital-sees-online-shoe-retailer-ipo-in-2015-2015-3]”Canada's Hardy Capital sees online shoe retailer IPO in 2015”]”[[Business Insider]]”March 2, 2015</ref> Hardy is also the co-founder and former Chairman, and [[CEO]] of [[Coastal.com|Coastal Contacts Inc.]] (TSX: COA, NASDAQ: COA), the leading manufacturer and [[online retailer]] of [[eyewear]] products.<ref>[http://investors.coastalcontacts.com/About-Us/The-Founder/default.aspx "The Founder"] ''Coastal Contacts''. 2012</ref> The Coastal Contacts Inc.’s family of websites includes [[Coastal.com]], ClearlyContacts.ca, Clearly.com.au, Clearly.co.nz, Lensway.co.uk and ContactSan.com.
== Early and personal life ==
Hardy was born in Toronto, Ontario and grew up in Eastern Canada where he attended [[Earl of March Secondary School]]. After graduating from [[Bishops University]], Hardy’s passion for skiing pulled him to the West Coast. He spent a year skiing in Whistler and came to the decision that BC was his home.<ref>Jordan, David [http://www.bcbusiness.ca/people/clearly-contacts-ceo-roger-hardy "Clearly Contacts CEO Roger Hardy]''[[BC Business]]''Nov 3, 2010.</ref>
While attending university, Hardy was a member of many sports teams where his competitive nature garnered him the Most Valuable Player of the year award. Later in his career, it was this competitive spirit that helped Hardy succeed in an online industry in which thousands had entered, and failed.<ref>Mitra, Sramana [http://www.sramanamitra.com/2010/11/12/building-a-niche-e-commerce-powerhouse-coastal-contacts-ceo-roger-hardy-part-1/ "Building A Niche E-Commerce Powerhouse: Coastal Contacts CEO Roger Hardy (Part 1)"] ''[[One Million by One Million]]''. Nov 12, 2010.</ref><ref>Shaw, Gillian [http://www.vancouversun.com/business/Clearly+Contacts+gamble+that+paid/9565466/story.html "Clearly Contacts was a gamble that paid off"]''[[The Vancouver Sun]]'' Feb 28, 2014.</ref>
Hardy currently resides in [[Vancouver, BC]] with his wife and children.
== Career ==
=== Coastal Contacts Inc. ===
Hardy first worked for a transportation and logistics company, followed by a [[contact lens]] company. While working at the contact lens company, Hardy recognized that purchasing contact lenses was expensive, time consuming and service constrained for consumers.
In 2000, Hardy founded Coastal Contacts Inc. The Company started in a basement office with one phone line, a 14K modem, a ping pong table and a Visa card. Hardy purchased the keyword “contact lens” from [[AltaVista]] and Snap.com. This keyword was not known to have any value at the time and no other companies were advertising on the keyword. Hardy bought the exclusive rights to “contact lenses” and launched with that advertising.<ref>Coastal Contacts [http://investors.coastal.com/Press-Room/News-Releases/Press-Release-Details/2009/Clearly-a-Winning-Strategy/default.aspx "Clearly a Winning Strategy"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120204192233/http://investors.coastal.com/Press-Room/News-Releases/Press-Release-Details/2009/Clearly-a-Winning-Strategy/default.aspx |date=2012-02-04 }}. 2012.</ref> In the first day, they had 30 orders; within the first month, they had $68,000 in sales.<ref>Jordan, David [http://www.bcbusiness.ca/people/clearly-contacts-ceo-roger-hardy "Clearly Contacts CEO Roger Hardy"] ''[[BC Business]]'' Nov 3, 2010.</ref><ref>[https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/small-business/sb-growth/success-stories/clearly-contacts-has-clear-vision-for-how-to-manage-growth/article2364571/ "Clearly Contacts has clear vision for how to manage growth"] ''[[the Globe and Mail]]'' Mar 12, 2012.</ref>
Under Hardy’s direction, Coastal Contacts Inc. became the world’s largest online retailer for eyewear. In 2001, Coastal achieved $1 million in cumulative revenue. In 2004, the Company began trading on TSX. In 2008, the Company launched eyeglasses business unit. In 2012, Coastal surpasses $1 billion in cumulative sales since 2000 and starts trading on NASDAQ.<ref>Coastal Contacts [http://investors.coastal.com/Investors/Financial-Reports/default.aspx "Financial Reports"]</ref><ref>Coastal Contacts [http://investors.coastal.com/Press-Room/News-Releases/Press-Release-Details/2012/Coastal-to-Begin-Trading-on-NASDAQ-as-COA1131576/default.aspx "Coastal to Begin Trading on NASDAQ"]</ref><ref>Nelson, Jacqueline [http://www.canadianbusiness.com/business-news/industries/consumer-goods/business-without-borders-coastal-contacts/ "Business without Borders: Coastal Contacts"] ''[[Canadian Business]]'' Mar 13, 2012.</ref>
Coastal Contacts Inc. and [[Essilor]] signed an agreement on February 27, 2014 that it is acquiring Coastal Contacts Inc. for C$430 million.<ref>Olijnyk, Zena [https://www.forbes.com/sites/mergermarket/2014/02/28/clearly-contacts-deal-some-saw-it-coming/ "Clearly Contacts Deal: Some Saw It Coming"]''[[Forbes]]'' Feb 28, 2014.</ref><ref>The Canadian Press [http://www.vancouversun.com/business/ClearlyContacts+operator+Coastal+being+bought+445M+Frances/9557789/story.html "Vancouver-based ClearlyContacts operator Coastal.com being bought for $430 million by France's Essilor"] ''[[The Vancouver Sun]]'' February 27, 2014.</ref><ref>Nelson, Jacqueline [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/streetwise/ "Coastal Contacts deal a marriage of tech and lenses"] ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'' February 27, 2014.</ref><ref>[http://watch.bnn.ca/the-business-news/#clip1071426] ''[[Business News Network|BNN]]'' February 27, 2014.</ref><ref>Korstrom, Glen [http://www.biv.com/article/20140304/BIV0119/303049924/coastal-contacts-pending-430-million-sale-good-news-for-local-e-commerce-ventures "Coastal Contacts' pending $430 million sale good news for local e-commerce ventures"]''[[Business in Vancouver]]'' March 4, 2014.</ref>
== Awards == In 2002, Hardy was recognized as Top 40 under 40 Award by Business in Vancouver. In 2006, Hardy was awarded the [[Ernst & Young]] Entrepreneur of the Year Award (Business to Consumer).<ref>Coastal Contacts [http://investors.coastal.com/Press-Room/News-Releases/Press-Release-Details/2006/Coastal-Contacts-CEO-Named-Entrepreneur-of-the-Year-Business-To-Consumer-Category/default.aspx "Coastal Contacts CEO Named Entrepreneur of the Year"] 2006.</ref> In 2009, Hardy received Bishop’s University Top 10 After 10 Award in 2009.
== Philanthropy ==
Hardy established the Hardy Endowment Fund at Bishops University which will pay the tuition for a student "in need" each year in perpetuity. Hardy is responsible for donating to and contributing countless hours along with his team at Coastal Contacts Inc. over the past years to charities close to their hearts. Easter Seals, The Ride to Conquer Cancer, The Greater Vancouver Food Bank, ORBIS Canada and The Red Cross are some of the many charities that he is involved with. Hardy has also contributed hundreds of pairs of free glasses to people in developing countries such as Mexico, El Salvador and Kenya, as well as disadvantaged people in Canada through Coastal Contacts Inc.’s own charity project, Change the View.<ref>Coastal Contacts [http://investors.coastal.com/Press-Room/News-Releases/Press-Release-Details/2011/Online-eyewear-company-to-Change-the-View-for-millions-around-the-world1124687/default.aspx "Online Eyewear Company to Change the View for Millions Around the World"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140304074011/http://investors.coastal.com/Press-Room/News-Releases/Press-Release-Details/2011/Online-eyewear-company-to-Change-the-View-for-millions-around-the-world1124687/default.aspx |date=2014-03-04 }} 2011.</ref><ref>[http://tfss.ca/blog/2013/12/clearly-contacts-celebrates-over-5000-glasses-donated-to-tfss "Clearly Contacts Celebrates Over 5,000 Glasses Donated to TFSS"] Dec 2, 2013.</ref>
